bug.short_desc: Signature jumps to top of HTML message when changed.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
When replying to HTML message and after entering some text I'll try to change signature, then it jumps to top of the message leaves most of entered text below it.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 3.20.3 (but this bug exist for several years)
How reproducible: Always.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Reply to existing HTML message. 2. Enter at least two lines of text (not full lines of text, one character per line or even Enter key is enough). 3. Change signature from top right menu to other.
Actual results: New signature jumps over entered text.
Expected results: New signature replaces old one without moving.
Additional info:

Hi Artur,
thank you for your bug report. I tried to reproduce this on 3.20.4, but without success. These are the steps and my settings I used. Please try to correct them with your values or steps.
Composer/General settings under Preferences:
Format messages in HTML mode -> not checked Reply style -> Quoted Start typing at the bottom on replying -> not checked Keep signature above the original message on replying -> not checked
I have an IMAP account with a newly created default signature set.
1. Select some existing HTML message 2. Press Ctrl + R 3. Select "Don't lose formatting" 4. Press Return 2 times so I will have two empty lines on the beginning of the message 5. Write "example text" there 6. Select another signature from the signature combo box 7. Signature is changed to the selected one and the position is not changed
Can you please use the steps that I wrote?

I forgot to mention that following setting:
Keep signature above the original message on replying -> checked
is essential to reproduce this bug :) Unchecking it is some kind of workaround, but not acceptable in my company where outlook is main client for exchange.
Regards Artur

(In reply to Artur Flinta from comment #2) > I forgot to mention that following setting: > > Keep signature above the original message on replying -> checked > > is essential to reproduce this bug :)
